title: Trying Mr. Trump, Private Citizen
summary: Democrats want to punish the ex-President but may revive him.. Democrats can't let go of Donald Trump even as a former President, so on Monday House managers walked their article of impeachment to the Senate for a trial. Their goal is to banish Mr. Trump from running for office again. The result may instead be his acquittal and political revival.

title: Chicago Teachers Union vs. Biden
summary: Even a federal bribe isn't enough to get them back teaching in classrooms.. The Chicago Teachers Union (CTU) this weekend vetoed Joe Biden's plan to reopen schools during his first 100 days by voting to continue remote learning indefinitely. The union is taking kids hostage to extract more money from Congress with no guarantee that it will release them if it does.

title: Vimeo Raises $300 Million in Equity, Valuing Company at $5 Billion
summary: Fundraising round comes one month after IAC said it intends to spin off the online-video platform. Video platform Vimeo Inc. has completed a $300 million fundraising round that values the company at $5 billion, an 82% boost from a raise three months ago.

title: Xi Jinping Wows Them at Davos
summary: China's President sweet-talks liberal leaders as he threatens Taiwan.. Chinese President Xi Jinping knows his audience. In his Monday address to the World Economic Forum, the annual meeting of global luminaries in Davos, Mr. Xi sounded like a liberal internationalist in good standing. He pulled out all the buzzwords that make Davosians swoon: "inclusive growth," "green development," "global governance" and "consensus building."

title: Yellen Passed the Economic Stability Baton to Powell. Now, He's Handing It Back.
summary: Their shared history and views set the stage for the closest working relationship between the Fed and Treasury in years. When Jerome Powell succeeded Janet Yellen as Federal Reserve chief three years ago, he hosted a farewell dinner party for her at his home in Chevy Chase, Md.

title: U.S. Forces Expand Reach in Saudi Arabia
summary: In the past year or more, the military has tested new ports and bases as options to use in the event of conflict with Iran.

title: NYPD Hunts for Suspects in Manhattan Assault
summary: A 26-year-old man was robbed and beaten in Chinatown midday Friday. New York Police Department detectives are searching for a dozen suspects in a daylight robbery that occurred at a busy intersection in the Manhattan neighborhood of Chinatown, police officials said.

title: Software Bots Multiply to Cope With 'Stretched' Resources
summary: Companies are tapping robotic process automation to streamline operations, meet changing customer needs. Companies plan to leverage software robots in the months ahead, as many grapple with strained resources and uncertain markets.

title: Apollo CEO Leon Black to Step Down Following Probe of Epstein Ties
summary: Independent probe finds Black wasn't involved in disgraced financier's criminal activities; Marc Rowan to take over top job by July 31. Leon Black plans to step down as chief executive of Apollo Global Management Inc. after an independent review revealed larger-than-expected payments to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein that it nevertheless deemed justified.

title: Biden's Stimulus Should Stay the Course
summary: Spending packages need triggers to sustain aid when the recovery lags and cut it off when things improve.. President Biden has proposed a bold and ambitious $1.9 trillion plan for economic recovery. The plan would benefit from one important change: It should be contingent on the pace of recovery. The Biden plan provides substantial support for the economy through the end of September but essentially ends on that date. It could be improved by including provisions that automatically continue assistance as long as the economy is weak and needs it. In exchange, these provisions could also phase out aid more quickly than Mr. Biden proposes if the economy rebounds faster than expected. Most important, this recession insurance should be made permanent to mitigate future recessions.

title: Workers Producing the Vaccine Need Vaccination
summary: If my company's employees get sick, there will be fewer shots for everyone.. In the race to vaccinate people for Covid-19, everyone agrees front-line health workers, the elderly and those with pre-existing conditions should get priority. But one vital group is being overlooked. Even worse, some are criticizing efforts to vaccinate them as some sort of effort to "cut the line."

title: Closing Time for Bars and Restaurants
summary: Few industries have been harder hit by Covid. We need relief.. Hattiesburg, Miss.

title: 'Stakeholder Capitalism' Review: The Global, Olympian 'We'
summary: Nations decide which problems to solve through politics. Global elites already know what problems need solving. Just ask them.. Refugee Run is an immersive theatrical experience at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, in which billionaires and other global elites pretend to be refugees for a little over an hour. In one promotional video, corporate executives wearing $1,000 loafers "escape" their "village" and make their way to a "refugee camp," where they must "bribe" actors playing camp guards. Facebook's Sheryl Sandberg flashes on-screen to attest: "I found it incredible . . . that you can put yourself in a room like this and feel as much as you feel." This focus on eliciting emotional responses from the wealthy and powerful at an Alpine ski resort, rather than providing material assistance to actual refugees, makes Refugee Run an appropriate charity for the Davos set.

title: Biden's Opening Salvo on Beijing
summary: His administration's early moves were aggressive, but will it sustain the pressure?. The Biden administration is less than a week old, but its most consequential foreign-policy decisions may already be behind it.

title: Electric Car Quotas Have a High Cost
summary: California wants to do it, and Biden wants to help-even though it will violate the law and cost us all.. President Biden can't mandate that we all drive electric cars, but he's opening the gates to an electric Trojan horse. In a day-one executive order, Mr. Biden began the process of rescinding a Trump administration rule, the first step toward greenlighting California's electric car agenda. California and like-minded states plan to impose electric cars through production quotas-whether drivers want the cars or not.

summary: The pandemic's longest and most deadly surge has posed risks to quality of care and left medical professionals exhausted. Mining that vein has paid off in a new way for the 68-year-old action star during the pandemic. He has scored two No. 1 movies in the last three months, by supplying multiplexes with much-needed new releases and audiences willing to turn out for his brand of movie.

title: Oxygen Scarcity Swells Covid-19's Death Toll
summary: From Brazil to Zambia, hospitals call for emergency resupplies; in some cases, patients suffocate. title: How to Dress for a Job Interview
summary: Most Popular News. The way you present yourself is often the first impression you make with a hiring manager, so it is important to make an effort. "When done right, your look isn't the first thing your prospective employer notices," says Dena Giannini, the style director for British Vogue. "They just notice that you are polished and possess an air of quiet confidence."

title: Helicopter Money for All Isn't What We Need
summary: The Cares Act wasn't entirely humanitarian aid and didn't stimulate growth. Increasing the amount to $2,000 won't make a difference.. John F. Cogan and John B. Taylor ("Those $2,000 Checks Won't Boost the Economy," op-ed, Jan. 15) are correct to note that much of this deficit spending will be saved, not spent. This is what we should expect when checks go to households with twice the median income. If spending is humanitarian aid for those who suffer most from the pandemic, it makes more sense to send checks only to households with incomes below the median or to people who have been unemployed for more than some number of months; the longer the period of unemployment, the larger the check.

title: Prof. Dershowitz on Impeaching the Departed
summary: Though the Nixon episode is similar to President Trump's, it is hardly a precedent. Nixon resigned the presidency.. In "No, You Can't Try an Impeached Former President" (op-ed, Jan. 21), Prof. Alan Dershowitz makes some technical arguments against the ability of the Senate to hold an impeachment trial against now former-President Trump. Fair enough, but when he discusses precedents, which are very rare, his attempt fails when he frames the nonimpeachment of Richard Nixon, who "left office in 1974 to avoid certain impeachment and conviction, there was no movement to continue the process."

title: Pajamas Have Their Place, but It Isn't at the Grocery
summary: While I am aware that there are individuals who wear pajamas to the grocery store, I am appalled that you would encourage it.. Concerning Katharine K. Zarrella's "Pajamas That Never Sleep" (Off Duty, Jan. 16): While I am aware that there are individuals who wear pajamas to the grocery store, I am appalled that you would encourage it. The only thing that idea is good for is a skit on "Saturday Night Live."

title: How to Give Two Weeks' Notice Without Burning Bridges
summary: Most Popular News. One of the most important steps in the process of transitioning to a new job is handing in and carrying out your two weeks' notice. The art of doing it is to keep it simple, stay positive and be respectful of the people you are leaving behind. When you have decided to move on to a new opportunity-or take a break-it is important to leave your current job gracefully. You may want to use your colleagues as references, and even if you don't, word can spread quickly in some industries if you leave on bad terms. "A lot is said of making a good first impression, but our last impressions are just as important in maintaining relationships that live on throughout your career," says Sarah Stoddard of corporate communications at Glassdoor. "Especially if you plan to maintain similar professional circles, it'll be key to leave your current role thoughtfully and on good terms."

title: Vaccine Delays Damp Prospect of Normal Summer in Europe
summary: Approval, manufacturing and delivery problems slow inoculation drive across the continent. Delays in Covid-19 vaccine deliveries and uncertainties about the prospects of yet-to-be-approved shots mean Europe is unlikely to have inoculated a substantial portion of its population by the summer, raising the specter of many more months of lockdowns and other restrictions.

title: Merck Scraps Covid Vaccine Candidates
summary: The two shots generated comparatively weak immune responses in early-stage studies. summary: The monumental decision to have a child got even more complicated in the past year-here's why some are still making the effort. It's a strange moment to bring a baby into the world.

title: China Overtakes U.S. as Leading Foreign-Investment Destination
summary: Flows into America nearly halved as Covid-19 dragged on the economy in 2020. China overtook the U.S. as the world's top destination for new foreign direct investment last year, as the Covid-19 pandemic amplifies an eastward shift in the center of gravity of the global economy.

title: Covid-19 Bill Negotiations Offer First Test of Biden's Bipartisanship Effort
summary: Talks could be upended if partisan frustrations rise during the second impeachment trial of his predecessor. WASHINGTON-President Biden's push for a sweeping coronavirus-relief bill is emerging as the first test of his pledge to return bipartisanship to Washington, a task made more difficult as partisan lines are hardening in the Senate over the impeachment fate of his predecessor.

title: Cuomo, Lawmakers Head for Tax-Increase Clash
summary: Senate Majority Leader Andrea Stewart-Cousins says she would push for the hike regardless of federal funding amount. The debate about raising taxes as part of New York's budget is shaping up to be a test of how far Democrats in the state Legislature will go to take on their party mate Gov. Andrew Cuomo.
